result.execSummary:
The defendant Dmarco J Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  
AS TO THIS AND RESTITUTION:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All aplicable fees of supervision.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

**01-13-15/ Timothy M. Witkowiak**
The Court ordered the JOC amended by reducing the sentence credit to 274 days on each Count

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol or contact with locations where drugs are packaged or sold.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITITION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended superivsion.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

**01-13-15/ Timothy M. Witkowiak**
The Court ordered the JOC amended by reducing the sentence credit to 274 days on each Count

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 01-13-15 Court order reducing sentence credit to 274 days on each Count
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and WI Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Letter from Department of Corrections seeking review of excessive sentence credit.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Dmarco J Perry in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Dmarco J Perry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Annette P.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS with 314 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program, but he IS eligible for the Earned Release program after 4 years confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol OR contact with locations where drugs are packaged or sold.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $165.00 payable to Joseph C.; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
PSI received and filed, parties notified report is ready for pick up.
For Presentence Investigation Report (PSI), SIGNED AND FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Dmarco J Perry in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Dmarco J Perry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 and COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI WAS ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing scheduled for 10-24-2014 at 08:30am.

Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $10,000.00 with same terms and conditions as set with previous bail.  Preliminary Hearing is already scheduled for 02-07-2014 at 01:30pm in Preliminary Court.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joseph C.; Shrina S. or Rodney B.
